citation.article-title: Murdochiella asaccharolytica gen. nov., sp. nov., a Gram-stain-positive, anaerobic coccus isolated from human wound specimens
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Murdochiella (Mur.do.chi.elâ€²la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Murdochiella named to honour Dr David A. Murdoch, British microbiologist, who has contributed so much to our knowledge of anaerobic bacteriology).
Cells are cocci, Gram-stain-positive and non-motile.
In PY and PYG broth, major amounts of lactic acid and moderate amounts of acetic, butyric and succinic acids are produced.
Do not hydrolyse aesculin or gelatin.
The type species is Murdochiella asaccharolytica.
